name: Knock Knock

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Hey mungo. This is an A B conversation so C your way out.{"mungo" said with derision}

topics.topic_text: Can you give me directions?
topics.response_text: To where, man?

topics.topic_text: I'm from Vault 101, and I rescued some of your friends from the Slavers.
topics.response_text: Oh, was that you? Nice work! I hope you got some good laughs out of it before you left - gotta make sure they know not to try that again!

topics.topic_text: I'm the big hero who rescued your friends from the Slavers. How's that for cool?
topics.response_text: It sure is! Nice work bringing them back.

topics.topic_text: You said you're in charge of "morale." What does that mean?
topics.response_text: Well, technically, I'm patrolling and "keeping the peace."

topics.topic_text: Sure, let's hear one.
topics.response_text: Prepare to be amused!

topics.topic_text: No. I don't have time for funny business.
topics.response_text: Aw, come on. Knock knock!{with gusto}

topics.topic_text: Who's there?
topics.response_text: Noah!{with gusto}

topics.topic_text: This is stupid.
topics.response_text: No it isn't. It's Noah!{refusing to be derailed}

topics.topic_text: Noah who?
topics.response_text: Noah place where I can get some food?{with gusto}

topics.topic_text: I refuse to play along.
topics.response_text: Noah place where I can get some food?{not to be denied his punchline}

topics.topic_text: Noah place where you can get some better jokes?
topics.response_text: Hey, that's good! I was just going to say, "Noah place where I can get some food?"{with gusto}

topics.topic_text: That was hysterical!
topics.response_text: Whoa, you really think so? Like, actually funny? Can you convince other folks to find them funny?

topics.topic_text: That was... um... really funny. <Lie.>
topics.response_text: Gee, thanks! I have to admit, most of them aren't really funny. At least, not ha-ha funny.

topics.topic_text: That couldn't have been a joke. Jokes are supposed to be funny.
topics.response_text: I know they aren't very funny. But that was a bit uncalled for.

topics.topic_text: Why don't you come up with new jokes or stories to tell?
topics.response_text: Oh, we've got lots of funny incidents. Like when Sammy shot the Raider who thought he was a girl, that sort of stuff.

topics.topic_text: That's the dumbest thing I've ever heard.
topics.response_text: That's only because you haven't heard all of the jokes from the book. Like this gem, "What's big, and red, and beats rocks?"

topics.topic_text: I've got a tale I could tell you.
topics.response_text: Oh, really? Tell me all about it!

topics.topic_text: My stories are my own business.
topics.response_text: Well, if you say so. But if you're ever looking for an audience, just let me know. I bet the town'd love to hear them, too!

topics.topic_text: Not long ago, my father left me. So I went searching for him.
topics.response_text: So, you're like a three-legged dog, then?

topics.topic_text: I left my dull life behind to search for fame and adventure in the Wasteland.
topics.response_text: Wow, that sounds like it took some guts.

topics.topic_text: Long ago, my people were buried away. Now, I've arisen, to terrorize the Wastes.
topics.response_text: A horror story, huh? So, are you here to terrorize evil, or is it a more generalized sort of terrorizing?

topics.topic_text: You'll have to wait. Storytime's over for now.
topics.response_text: Oh, come on! Please? I promise not to interrupt!

topics.topic_text: I'd tell you more, but I'm still working on how it ends.
topics.response_text: That makes sense, I suppose. A good story can take a while to put together, you know?

topics.topic_text: That's it. Storytime's over for now.
topics.response_text: Oh, come on! It was just one joke!

topics.topic_text: Why are you called Knock Knock?
topics.response_text: Well, when people started calling Knicky by his new name, I needed one too, see?

topics.topic_text: Didn't I just meet you?
topics.response_text: Was I all obsessed with stuff and toys?

topics.topic_text: That was pretty funny! <Lie>
topics.response_text: You don't have to lie to make me feel better. I know it's a dumb joke. We don't really tell them to laugh with them - more to laugh at them.

conversation.response_text: Wanna hear a joke? A guy walks into a town of kids and causes trouble. Then they shoot him to death. Get it? Watch out, or you will.{Jovial and friendly, until "Then they shoot him to death", where it becomes deadpan and threatening.}
Hey, Eclair! What do you call a mushroom that knows how to party?
So, the main character of our story, their father left in the middle of the night. Now, they're wandering the Wastes, searching everywhere for him.
Last I heard, he's still out there, wandering the Wastes. Who knows what we'll hear next about his story?
They say he still wanders the Wasteland now, and woe to anyone who stands in his way!
Stalacti... er, I mean... All's well around town, sir! No funny business! Except for me, of course.{Stammering briefly, as he tries to avoid saying "stalactites" in response to MacCready's setup.}
Doing better than a dog in a bone-yard!
So, bro, made any good trades today?
Do I ever? How about you? Made any good trades today?{Cheerfully self-deprecating}
That's hysterical! Zip was running around, checking every rock he found all day!
Fun times and laughs as always!

description:
Knock Knock is a 12 year-old Caucasian Female.

A cheerful and energetic young girl who serves as the morale officer of Little Lamplight. Known for her endless supply of jokes and puns, she brightens the spirits of the other children with her humor and wit.

Knock Knock's Personality: Cheerful, playful, and quick-witted. Knock Knock is always trying to make others laugh and uses humor as a way to cope with the harsh reality of the wasteland. She's friendly to newcomers but can be a bit mischievous at times.

Knock Knock's Backstory: Born in the wasteland as Sue, she was taken to Little Lamplight as a young child. The community's strict policy of only allowing children under 16 meant she had to adapt to life underground. After discovering a book of jokes in the ruins of Vault 87 during an exploration trip, she found her calling. She adopted the nickname 'Knock Knock' and has dedicated herself to making the other children smile, even in their difficult circumstances.
